test_cases.name: Delete button confirms and calls onDelete
test_cases.description: Ensures that clicking Delete prompts for confirmation and, if confirmed, calls onDelete with the task id.

test_setup.given: task with id; mock onDelete; confirmation dialog returns true
test_setup.when: User clicks Delete button and confirms
test_setup.then: onDelete is called once with the task id

test_cases.name: Delete button cancel does not call onDelete
test_cases.description: Ensures that if the user cancels the delete confirmation, onDelete is not called.

test_setup.given: task with id; mock onDelete; confirmation dialog returns false
test_setup.when: User clicks Delete button and cancels
test_setup.then: onDelete is not called

test_cases.name: Render priority badge for all priority levels
test_cases.description: Checks that the priority badge is rendered correctly for each possible priority value.

test_setup.given: task with priority set to each allowed value (e.g., High, Medium, Low)
test_setup.then: Priority badge displays the correct label and style for each value

test_cases.name: Handles missing handlers gracefully
test_cases.description: Ensures the component does not throw errors if onToggleComplete, onEdit, or onDelete are undefined.

test_setup.given: task; one or more handler props are undefined
test_setup.when: User clicks Done, Edit, or Delete
test_setup.then: No uncaught errors are thrown; component remains stable

test_cases.name: Handles null task prop
test_cases.description: Checks that the component does not crash and renders nothing or a fallback if the task prop is null.

test_setup.given: task is null
test_setup.then: Component renders nothing or a fallback UI; no errors are thrown

test_cases.name: Renders Undo button when task is completed
test_cases.description: Ensures the Undo button is shown instead of Done when the task is completed.

test_setup.given: task with completed: true
test_setup.then: Undo button is visible; Done button is not

test_cases.name: Renders Done button when task is pending
test_cases.description: Ensures the Done button is shown when the task is not completed.

test_setup.given: task with completed: false
test_setup.then: Done button is visible; Undo button is not

test_cases.name: Long title and description are truncated or wrapped
test_cases.description: Checks that very long titles and descriptions are handled gracefully (truncated, wrapped, or overflow managed).

test_setup.given: task with very long title and description
test_setup.then: Text does not overflow the component; UI remains usable

test_cases.name: Handles invalid due date format
test_cases.description: Ensures the component does not crash and displays a fallback or nothing if due date is invalid.

test_setup.given: task with dueDate set to an invalid string
test_setup.then: No errors are thrown; due date is not displayed or a fallback is shown

test_cases.name: Delete existing task successfully
test_cases.description: Verify that deleting an existing task returns a success message and the task is removed.

test_setup.given: A task with ID 123 exists in the database.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/123.
test_setup.then: The response status is 200 and the task is removed from the database.

test_cases.name: Delete non-existent task
test_cases.description: Verify that deleting a non-existent task returns a 404 error.

test_setup.given: No task with ID 99999 exists in the database.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/99999.
test_setup.then: The response status is 404 with an appropriate error message.

test_cases.name: Delete task with invalid ID format
test_cases.description: Verify that deleting a task with an invalid ID format returns a 422 or 400 error.

test_setup.given: The task_id parameter is not a valid integer.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/abc.
test_setup.then: The response status is 422 or 400 with an error indicating invalid ID format.

test_cases.name: Delete task that was already deleted
test_cases.description: Verify that deleting a task that was already deleted returns a 404 error.

test_setup.given: A task with ID 124 existed but was deleted previously.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/124.
test_setup.then: The response status is 404 with an appropriate error message.

test_cases.name: Delete task without authentication
test_cases.description: Verify that deleting a task without authentication returns a 401 error if authentication is required.

test_setup.given: A task with ID 125 exists and the API requires authentication.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/125 without authentication headers.
test_setup.then: The response status is 401 with an authentication error message.

test_cases.name: Delete task with ID zero
test_cases.description: Verify that deleting a task with ID 0 returns a 404 or 422 error.

test_setup.given: No task with ID 0 exists.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/0.
test_setup.then: The response status is 404 or 422 with an appropriate error message.

test_cases.name: Delete task with negative ID
test_cases.description: Verify that deleting a task with a negative ID returns a 422 or 404 error.

test_setup.given: The task_id parameter is negative.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/-1.
test_setup.then: The response status is 422 or 404 with an error indicating invalid ID.

test_cases.name: Delete task with extra request body
test_cases.description: Verify that sending a DELETE request with an unexpected body is handled gracefully.

test_setup.given: A task with ID 126 exists.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/126 with an extra JSON body.
test_setup.then: The response status is 200 and the task is deleted, ignoring the extra body.
